books.title: Principles for dealing with the Changing World Order
books.bodyText:
Often hear that history repeats itself? A macro investor applies that principle to financial and power cycles in the world. 

 I found this cyclical approach humbling, systematic and optimistic.

books.title: Range: why generalists triumph in a specialized world
books.bodyText:
Explains the exponential opportunity cost of trying to find a niche - and compares it the more humbling but also more liberating pursuit of generalism. 

 I found this quite instructive in my academic and career pursuits.

books.title: Poverty by America
books.bodyText:
Critical review of the american economic system, its flaws and intentional poverty. 

 A scathing and very well-delivered social contribution.

books.title: Lies my teacher told me
books.bodyText:
Revisionist history of America and criticism of state-sponsored historiography. 

 Very powerful and timely reminder of the responsibility and potential of history in shaping our lives.

books.title: Things Fall Apart
books.bodyText:
Missionaries bring upheaval to an African tribe - a masterpiece of Nigerian literature. 

 A very haunting portrayal of colonialism.

books.title: Lessons in Chemistry
books.bodyText: Extremely entertaining novel about gender parity in STEM recommended by my friend's grandmother!
